TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ValuePattern/ValuePatternInformation extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides access to the property values of a object using its or accessors.
Docs.related: UI Automation Control Patterns for Clients

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the value of a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element is read-only.
Docs.value: if the value is read-only; if it can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A control should have its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.IsEnabledProperty> set to `true` and its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.IsReadOnlyProperty> set to `false` before the client attempts a call to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.SetValue%2A>.
## Examples In the following example, an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> that supports the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> control pattern has its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.RangeValuePattern.ValueProperty> set to a user-specified value.
[!code-csharp[UIAValuePattern_snip#103](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#103)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#103](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#103)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Value As String
public: property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element.
Docs.value: The value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element as a string. The default is an empty string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Single-line edit controls support programmatic access to their contents through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>. However, multi-line edit controls do not support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> control pattern.
To retrieve the textual contents of multi-line edit controls the controls must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> control pattern. However, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> does not support setting the value of a control.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> does not support the retrieval of formatting information or substring values. The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> control pattern must be used in these scenarios.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> object obtained from a target control is passed into a function that retrieves the current <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> property values.
[!code-csharp[UIAValuePattern_snip#102](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAValuePattern_snip/CSharp/UIAValuePattern_snippets.cs#102)] [!code-vb[UIAValuePattern_snip#102](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAValuePattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIAValuePattern_snippets.vb#102)]
